notes: HSA/FSA payment infrastructure for health & wellness ecommerce brands. Early-stage startup (11-50 employees, seed-to-Series B range). 700% engineering growth over 2 years. Partner directly with founders. Hands-on expected. Healthcare-adjacent (payments, not clinical). $150B TAM in HSA/FSA spending.

requirements_matched: 8+ years engineering experience with 2-3 years leadership — 20+ years experience, CTO/VP/Director roles spanning 5 companies
Proven team builder — Built 3 teams from zero (0→22 MedQuest, 0→15 Red Spot, 0→10 Perceptive), hired/mentored/retained engineers
Architectural thinker — Designed and scaled distributed systems: monolith-to-microservices (Cognizant), multi-tenant architecture, 99.9% uptime (ilumed)
Own technical roadmap with founders — Multi-quarter roadmaps driving 20% operational efficiency (ilumed), $2M budget alignment (MedQuest), CTO-level strategic partnership at multiple companies
Set engineering standards — Instituted DevOps/CI/CD improving reliability 35% and deployment frequency 50% (Red Spot), agile best practices increasing velocity 15%
Drive delivery — Managed execution delivering 4 product launches annually (Red Spot), 4 mobile apps (Perceptive), diagnostic imaging across 100 centers (MedQuest)
Engage cross-functionally — Collaborated with operations, product, clinical teams; aligned technical roadmaps with business needs growing client base 12%
Startup experience — Built from zero at Perceptive (startup), Red Spot (startup), led in resource-constrained fast-moving environments
AWS familiarity (strong plus) — AWS integrations accelerating deployment 25% (Cognizant), multi-cloud AWS/Azure/SaaS platform (Red Spot)
Low ego, comfortable with ambiguity — Built 3 companies from nothing, repeatedly navigated startup uncertainty
requirements_partial: Depth in backend systems and APIs, conversant across full stack — Strong backend/API/architecture experience but recent roles are leadership-heavy, not hands-on coding. NodeJS, Python, Java in stack but daily coding contribution may be rusty at the IC level
Hands-on contributor to codebase — CTO/VP-level for past 10+ years. Can architect and review but active coding contribution is likely limited compared to what an early-stage startup expects
TypeScript, Rust, Postgres, Redis (strong plus) — SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, DynamoDB in stack but TypeScript and Rust not documented. Postgres is adjacent to SQL Server/MySQL. Redis not documented
gaps: TypeScript and Rust — Not in documented technical stack
Redis — Not in documented technical stack
Payments/fintech domain — No payment infrastructure or checkout experience documented
Hands-on coding expectation — At CTO/VP level for 10+ years, may not meet the 'roll up sleeves and code' expectation of a 40-person startup
addressable_gaps: TypeScript/Rust — Strong plus not must-have. TypeScript is adjacent to NodeJS experience. Rust is a different paradigm but learnable for a seasoned engineer
Redis — Adjacent to DynamoDB and other data stores in stack. Straightforward to pick up
Payments domain — Healthcare IT involves complex data flows, compliance, and transaction processing. HSA/FSA payments bridge healthcare and fintech, which is actually a unique positioning angle
hard_gaps: Hands-on coding — This could be a real mismatch. They want someone who 'rolls up sleeves' and contributes to the codebase. At a 40-person startup, the Head of Eng likely codes 30-40% of their time. Jimmy's recent decade has been leadership-focused. This depends on how current his hands-on skills are.
